question_1.question: What can TimeXtender 6024.1 Documentation be generated for?

options.option_d: ODX instances, Data Warehouse instances, and Semantic Model instances

question_1.explanation: TimeXtender 6024.1 Documentation can be generated for ODX instances, Data Warehouse instances, and Semantic Model instances, including individual data areas within instances.

question_2.question: How can you generate a deployment status report in TimeXtender?

options.option_b: By generating it on an instance or data area level

question_2.explanation: A deployment status report can be generated on an instance level as well as a data area level within TimeXtender.

question_3.question: What should you do to edit a documentation template in TimeXtender?

options.option_a: Click Add in the window that opens
options.option_b: Type a new name in the Name box
options.option_c: Click on the template you want to edit in the list
options.option_d: Delete the old template and create a new one

question_3.explanation: To edit a documentation template, you should click on the template you want to edit in the list that appears after clicking Manage.

question_4.question: Which of the following is NOT an option for including descriptions in TimeXtender documentation?

options.option_a: As plain text without any formatting
options.option_b: As rich text in attached RTF files
options.option_c: As encrypted text for security purposes

question_4.explanation: The options for including descriptions in TimeXtender documentation are as plain text, as rich text in attached RTF files, or no descriptions at all. Encrypted text is not mentioned as an option.

question_5.question: What is the purpose of the 'Include instance tree' option in TimeXtender documentation settings?

options.option_a: To include a list of all users with access to the instance
options.option_b: To include a rendering of the instance tree in the document
options.option_c: To include a family tree of the developers
options.option_d: To include a tree diagram of the network infrastructure

question_5.explanation: The 'Include instance tree' option is used to include a rendering of the instance tree in the TimeXtender documentation.

question_6.question: What happens when you click 'Reset to Defaults' in the Documentation Settings of TimeXtender?

options.option_a: It resets the template to the last saved state
options.option_c: It resets the style settings to their defaults
options.option_d: It logs you out of TimeXtender

question_6.explanation: Clicking 'Reset to Defaults' in the Documentation Settings of TimeXtender resets the style settings to their default values.
